revised_title: Heat-Contraction of Skeletal Muscle: Proteid Coagulation and Temperature Effects
tldr: The authors investigate the heat-contraction of skeletal muscle and find that the contractions are caused by the heat-coagulation of different proteids. They also observe that the temperatures of these contractions correspond with the proteids' coagulation points as determined by von Firsch. The study includes experiments with both frog and mammalian muscle.
